Introduction

B2B Whitelabel API documentation

Base URL: http://store-api.express.test

This documentation aims to provide all the information you need to work with our API.

As you scroll, you'll see code examples for working with the API in different programming languages in the dark area to the right (or as part of the content on mobile). You can switch the language used with the tabs at the top right (or from the nav menu at the top left on mobile).

Authenticating requests

To authenticate requests, include an Authorization header with the value "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}".

All authenticated endpoints are marked with a requires authentication badge in the documentation below.

You can retrieve your token by visiting your dashboard and clicking Sign In (Generate API token).

Advertising

Update products

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/advertising/update/products" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Uuid: 11152111-2222-3333-4444-555e23017555" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/advertising/update/products"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Uuid": "11152111-2222-3333-4444-555e23017555",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/advertising/update/products';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Uuid' => '11152111-2222-3333-4444-555e23017555',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/advertising/update/products'
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Uuid': '11152111-2222-3333-4444-555e23017555',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/advertising/update/products

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Uuid       required  

Example: 11152111-2222-3333-4444-555e23017555

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Brand

Create Brand

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"Nike\",
        \"image\": \"img.jpg\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "Nike",
        "image": "img.jpg"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/create';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'name' => 'Nike',
                'image' => 'img.jpg',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/create'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "name": "Nike",
        "image": "img.jpg"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/brand/create

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
name   string    required  

Example: Nike

image   string  optional    

Example: img.jpg

Update Brand

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/update" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"name\": \"Nike\",
        \"image\": \"img.jpg\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/update"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Nike",
        "image": "img.jpg"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/update';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'name' => 'Nike',
                'image' => 'img.jpg',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/update'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Nike",
        "image": "img.jpg"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/brand/update

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
id   integer    required  

Example: 1

name   string    required  

Example: Nike

image   string  optional    

Example: img.jpg

Delete Brand

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/delete';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/delete'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/brand/delete

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
items   integer[]    required  

Get Brand

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get?id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get"
);

const params = {
    "id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'id' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get'
params = {
  'id': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/brand/get

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

id   integer    required  

The ID of the brand. Example: 1

Get all Brands

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get-list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"page\": 1,
        \"pageSize\": 3,
        \"filter\": {
            \"searchTerm\": \"\\\"\\\"\"
        },
        \"sort\": \"name:asc\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "page": 1,
        "pageSize": 3,
        "filter": {
            "searchTerm": "\"\""
        },
        "sort": "name:asc"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get-list';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'page' => 1,
                'pageSize' => 3,
                'filter' => [
                    'searchTerm' => '""',
                ],
                'sort' => 'name:asc',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/brand/get-list'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "page": 1,
        "pageSize": 3,
        "filter": {
            "searchTerm": "\"\""
        },
        "sort": "name:asc"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

Example response (400):


{
    "error": {
        "message": "Data key is required",
        "code": 400
    }
}
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/brand/get-list

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
page   integer  optional    

Example: 1

pageSize   integer  optional    

Example: 3

filter   object  optional    
searchTerm   string  optional    

Example: ""

sort   string  optional    

Example: name:asc

Category

Update Categories Order

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/update-order" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            {
                \"id\": 1,
                \"sortIndex\": 2
            }
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/update-order"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "sortIndex": 2
            }
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/update-order';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    [
                        'id' => 1,
                        'sortIndex' => 2,
                    ],
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/update-order'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "sortIndex": 2
            }
        ]
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/category/update-order

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
items   object[]    required  
id   integer    required  

Example: 1

sortIndex   integer    required  

Example: 2

Delete Categories

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/delete';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/delete'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Get Category

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/get?id=1&slug=clothes" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/get"
);

const params = {
    "id": "1",
    "slug": "clothes",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/get';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'id' => '1',
            'slug' => 'clothes',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/category/get'
params = {
  'id': '1',
  'slug': 'clothes',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/category/get

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

id   integer    required  

The ID of the category. Example: 1

slug   string  optional    

The slug of the category. Example: clothes

Coupon

Create Coupon

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"COUPONNAME\",
        \"percentage\": 30,
        \"permanent\": true,
        \"startDate\": \"2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z\",
        \"endDate\": \"2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "COUPONNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/create';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'name' => 'COUPONNAME',
                'percentage' => 30,
                'permanent' => true,
                'startDate' => '2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z',
                'endDate' => '2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/create'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "name": "COUPONNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/coupon/create

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
name   string    required  

Example: COUPONNAME

percentage   integer    required  

Example: 30

permanent   boolean    required  

Example: true

startDate   string  optional    

optional Example: 2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z

endDate   string  optional    

optional Example: 2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z

Update Coupon

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/update" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"name\": \"COUPONNAME\",
        \"percentage\": 30,
        \"permanent\": true,
        \"startDate\": \"2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z\",
        \"endDate\": \"2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/update"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "COUPONNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/update';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'name' => 'COUPONNAME',
                'percentage' => 30,
                'permanent' => true,
                'startDate' => '2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z',
                'endDate' => '2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Get Coupon

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/get?id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/get"
);

const params = {
    "id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/get';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'id' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Get all Coupons

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/get-list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"filter\": {
            \"searchTerm\": \"\\\"\\\"\"
        }
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/get-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "filter": {
            "searchTerm": "\"\""
        }
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/get-list';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'filter' => [
                    'searchTerm' => '""',
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Delete Coupons

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/delete';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Add Product Variations to Coupon

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/add-product-entries" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"productEntries\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/add-product-entries"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "productEntries": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/coupon/add-product-entries';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'productEntries' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

            1,
            2
        ]
    }

  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

all   boolean  optional    

optional Example: false

Customer

Create Customer

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"John Doe\",
        \"phoneNumber\": \"+44777777777\",
        \"email\": \"test@example.com\",
        \"country\": \"NG\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"state\": \"MAN\",
        \"zipPostal\": \"M4U678\",
        \"address\": \"Some str. 123\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "phoneNumber": "+44777777777",
        "email": "test@example.com",
        "country": "NG",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "MAN",
        "zipPostal": "M4U678",
        "address": "Some str. 123"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/create';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'name' => 'John Doe',
                'phoneNumber' => '+44777777777',
                'email' => 'test@example.com',
                'country' => 'NG',
                'city' => 'Manchester',
                'state' => 'MAN',
                'zipPostal' => 'M4U678',
                'address' => 'Some str. 123',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Get Customer

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get?id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get"
);

const params = {
    "id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'id' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get'
params = {
  'id': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/customer/get

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

id   integer    required  

The ID of the Customer. Example: 1

Update Customer

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/update" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"name\": \"John Doe\",
        \"phoneNumber\": \"+44777777777\",
        \"email\": \"test@example.com\",
        \"country\": \"NG\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"state\": \"MAN\",
        \"zipPostal\": \"M4U678\",
        \"address\": \"Some str. 123\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/update"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "John Doe",
        "phoneNumber": "+44777777777",
        "email": "test@example.com",
        "country": "NG",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "MAN",
        "zipPostal": "M4U678",
        "address": "Some str. 123"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/update';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'name' => 'John Doe',
                'phoneNumber' => '+44777777777',
                'email' => 'test@example.com',
                'country' => 'NG',
                'city' => 'Manchester',
                'state' => 'MAN',
                'zipPostal' => 'M4U678',
                'address' => 'Some str. 123',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/update'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "John Doe",
        "phoneNumber": "+44777777777",
        "email": "test@example.com",
        "country": "NG",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "MAN",
        "zipPostal": "M4U678",
        "address": "Some str. 123"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()

POST api/v3/customer/update

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
id   integer    required  

Example: 1

name   string    required  

Example: John Doe

phoneNumber   string    required  

Example: +44777777777

email   string  optional    

Example: test@example.com

country   string  optional    

Example: NG

city   string  optional    

Example: Manchester

state   string  optional    

Example: MAN

zipPostal   string  optional    

Example: M4U678

address   string  optional    

Example: Some str. 123

Get all Customers

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get-list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"filter\": {
            \"searchTerm\": \"\\\"\\\"\"
        },
        \"sort\": \"name:asc\",
        \"page\": 1,
        \"pageSize\": 10
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "filter": {
            "searchTerm": "\"\""
        },
        "sort": "name:asc",
        "page": 1,
        "pageSize": 10
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/get-list';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'filter' => [
                    'searchTerm' => '""',
                ],
                'sort' => 'name:asc',
                'page' => 1,
                'pageSize' => 10,
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

searchTerm   string  optional    

Example: ""

Example: 10

Delete Customers

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/delete';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Check Customer Exists

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/exists" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"phoneNumber\": \"\\\"447777777\\\"\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/exists"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "phoneNumber": "\"447777777\""
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/customer/exists';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'phoneNumber' => '"447777777"',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

        "message": "Data key is required",
        "code": 400

Delivery

[type:delivery] Create Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--delivery" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"Quick Delivery\",
        \"type\": \"delivery\",
        \"price\": \"18.00\",
        \"useBusinessAddress\": true,
        \"isGlobal\": true,
        \"description\": \"Quick delivery\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--delivery"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "delivery",
        "price": "18.00",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "isGlobal": true,
        "description": "Quick delivery"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--delivery';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'name' => 'Quick Delivery',
                'type' => 'delivery',
                'price' => '18.00',
                'useBusinessAddress' => true,
                'isGlobal' => true,
                'description' => 'Quick delivery',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

[type:pickup] Create Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--pickup" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"Quick Delivery\",
        \"type\": \"pickup\",
        \"price\": \"0\",
        \"useBusinessAddress\": true,
        \"country\": \"NG\",
        \"zipPostal\": \"16\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"state\": \"Manchester\",
        \"address\": \"Some str. 123\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--pickup"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "pickup",
        "price": "0",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "country": "NG",
        "zipPostal": "16",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "Manchester",
        "address": "Some str. 123"
    }
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

                'country' => 'NG',
                'zipPostal' => '16',

);

[type:shiip] Create Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--shiip" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"Quick Delivery\",
        \"type\": \"shiip\",
        \"price\": \"0\",
        \"useBusinessAddress\": true,
        \"description\": \"Some test doc description\",
        \"country\": \"NG\",
        \"zipPostal\": \"16\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"state\": \"Manchester\",
        \"address\": \"Some str. 123\",
        \"defaultWeight\": \"3.85\",
        \"secretKey\": \"hBUvTVTGyhIUhUI798&*89\",
        \"userName\": \"John Brown\",
        \"phone\": \"+1233456789\",
        \"email\": \"test@test.com\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/create-type--shiip"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "shiip",
        "price": "0",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "description": "Some test doc description",
        "country": "NG",
        "zipPostal": "16",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "Manchester",
        "address": "Some str. 123",
        "defaultWeight": "3.85",
        "secretKey": "hBUvTVTGyhIUhUI798&*89",
        "userName": "John Brown",
        "phone": "+1233456789",
        "email": "test@test.com"
    }
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'name' => 'Quick Delivery',
                'type' => 'shiip',
                'price' => '0',
                'useBusinessAddress' => true,
                'description' => 'Some test doc description',

                'userName' => 'John Brown',
                'phone' => '+1233456789',
                'email' => 'test@test.com',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);

Example: Some test doc description

country   string    required  

Example: NG

zipPostal   string    required  

Example: 16

city   string    required  

Example: Manchester

state   string    required  

Example: Manchester

address   string    required  

Example: Some str. 123

defaultWeight   string    required  

Parameter for Shiip only Example: 3.85

secretKey   string    required  

Parameter for Shiip only Example: hBUvTVTGyhIUhUI798&*89

userName   string    required  

Parameter for Shiip only Example: John Brown

phone   string    required  

Parameter for Shiip only Example: +1233456789

email   string    required  

Parameter for Shiip only Example: test@test.com

[type:delivery] Update Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--delivery" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": null,
        \"name\": \"Quick Delivery\",
        \"type\": \"delivery\",
        \"price\": \"18.00\",
        \"useBusinessAddress\": true,
        \"isGlobal\": true,
        \"description\": \"Quick delivery\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--delivery"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": null,
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "delivery",
        "price": "18.00",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "isGlobal": true,
        "description": "Quick delivery"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--delivery';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => null,
                'name' => 'Quick Delivery',
                'type' => 'delivery',
                'price' => '18.00',
                'useBusinessAddress' => true,
                'isGlobal' => true,
                'description' => 'Quick delivery',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--delivery'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "id": null,
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "delivery",
        "price": "18.00",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "isGlobal": true,
        "description": "Quick delivery"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

POST api/v3/delivery/update

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
id   integer    required  
name   string    required  

Example: Quick Delivery

type   string    required  

Example: delivery

price   string    required  

Example: 18.00

useBusinessAddress   boolean    required  

Example: true

isGlobal   boolean    required  

Example: true

description   string  optional    

Example: Quick delivery

[type:pickup] Update Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--pickup" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"name\": \"Quick Delivery\",
        \"type\": \"pickup\",
        \"price\": \"0\",
        \"useBusinessAddress\": true,
        \"country\": \"NG\",
        \"zipPostal\": \"16\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"state\": \"Manchester\",
        \"address\": \"Some str. 123\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--pickup"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "pickup",
        "price": "0",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "country": "NG",
        "zipPostal": "16",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "Manchester",
        "address": "Some str. 123"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--pickup';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'name' => 'Quick Delivery',
                'type' => 'pickup',
                'price' => '0',
                'useBusinessAddress' => true,
                'country' => 'NG',
                'zipPostal' => '16',
                'city' => 'Manchester',
                'state' => 'Manchester',
                'address' => 'Some str. 123',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

[type:shiip] Update Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--shiip" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"name\": \"Quick Delivery\",
        \"type\": \"shiip\",
        \"price\": \"0\",
        \"useBusinessAddress\": true,
        \"description\": \"Some test doc description\",
        \"country\": \"NG\",
        \"zipPostal\": \"16\",
        \"city\": \"Manchester\",
        \"state\": \"Manchester\",
        \"address\": \"Some str. 123\",
        \"defaultWeight\": \"3.85\",
        \"secretKey\": \"hBUvTVTGyhIUhUI798&*89\",
        \"userName\": \"John Brown\",
        \"phone\": \"+1233456789\",
        \"email\": \"test@test.com\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-type--shiip"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "Quick Delivery",
        "type": "shiip",
        "price": "0",
        "useBusinessAddress": true,
        "description": "Some test doc description",
        "country": "NG",
        "zipPostal": "16",
        "city": "Manchester",
        "state": "Manchester",
        "address": "Some str. 123",
        "defaultWeight": "3.85",
        "secretKey": "hBUvTVTGyhIUhUI798&*89",
        "userName": "John Brown",
        "phone": "+1233456789",
        "email": "test@test.com"
    }
};

    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());

    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'name' => 'Quick Delivery',
                'type' => 'shiip',
                'price' => '0',
                'useBusinessAddress' => true,
                'description' => 'Some test doc description',

                'phone' => '+1233456789',
                'email' => 'test@test.com',

        ],
    ]
);

Get Delivery Method

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get?id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get"
);

const params = {
    "id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'id' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get'
params = {
  'id': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

The ID of the Delivery Method. Example: 1

Get all Delivery Methods

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get-list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/get-list';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Update Delivery Methods Order

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-order" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            {
                \"id\": 1,
                \"sortIndex\": 2
            }
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-order"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            {
                "id": 1,
                "sortIndex": 2
            }
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/update-order';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    [
                        'id' => 1,
                        'sortIndex' => 2,
                    ],
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

import json

Delete Delivery Methods

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/delivery/delete';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));

Discount

Create Discount

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/create" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"name\": \"DISCOUNTNAME\",
        \"percentage\": 30,
        \"permanent\": true,
        \"startDate\": \"2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z\",
        \"endDate\": \"2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/create"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "name": "DISCOUNTNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/create';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'name' => 'DISCOUNTNAME',
                'percentage' => 30,
                'permanent' => true,
                'startDate' => '2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z',
                'endDate' => '2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/create'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "name": "DISCOUNTNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/discount/create

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
name   string    required  

Example: DISCOUNTNAME

percentage   integer    required  

Example: 30

permanent   boolean    required  

Example: true

startDate   string  optional    

optional Example: 2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z

endDate   string  optional    

optional Example: 2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z

Update Discount

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/update" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"name\": \"DISCOUNTNAME\",
        \"percentage\": 30,
        \"permanent\": true,
        \"startDate\": \"2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z\",
        \"endDate\": \"2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z\"
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/update"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "DISCOUNTNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/update';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'name' => 'DISCOUNTNAME',
                'percentage' => 30,
                'permanent' => true,
                'startDate' => '2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z',
                'endDate' => '2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z',
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/update'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "DISCOUNTNAME",
        "percentage": 30,
        "permanent": true,
        "startDate": "2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z",
        "endDate": "2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z"
    }
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('POST', url, headers=headers, json=payload)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

POST api/v3/discount/update

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
id   integer    required  

Example: 1

name   string    required  

Example: DISCOUNTNAME

percentage   integer    required  

Example: 30

permanent   boolean    required  

Example: true

startDate   string  optional    

optional Example: 2023-01-05T14:48:00.000Z

endDate   string  optional    

optional Example: 2023-10-05T14:48:00.000Z

Get Discount

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request GET \
    --get "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/get?id=1" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/get"
);

const params = {
    "id": "1",
};
Object.keys(params)
    .forEach(key => url.searchParams.append(key, params[key]));

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "GET",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/get';
$response = $client->get(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'query' => [
            'id' => '1',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/get'
params = {
  'id': '1',
}
headers = {
  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

response = requests.request('GET', url, headers=headers, params=params)
response.json()
Received response:
Request failed with error:


Tip: Check that you're properly connected to the network.
If you're a maintainer of ths API, verify that your API is running and you've enabled CORS.
You can check the Dev Tools console for debugging information.

Request      

GET api/v3/discount/get

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Query Parameters

id   integer    required  

The ID of the Discount. Example: 1

Delete Discounts

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/delete" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"items\": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/delete"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/delete';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'items' => [
                    1,
                    2,
                ],
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/delete'
payload = {
    "data": {
        "items": [
            1,
            2
        ]
    }
}

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'
}

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
items   integer[]    required  

Add Product Variations to Discount

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/add-product-entries" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json" \
    --data "{
    \"data\": {
        \"id\": 1,
        \"productEntries\": null
    }
}"

const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/add-product-entries"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

let body = {
    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "productEntries": null
    }
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
    body: JSON.stringify(body),
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/discount/add-product-entries';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
        'json' => [
            'data' => [
                'id' => 1,
                'productEntries' => null,
            ],
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
import requests
import json

    "data": {
        "id": 1,
        "productEntries": null
    }

  'Authorization': 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  'Accept': 'application/json'

response.json()

Request failed with error:

Request      

POST api/v3/discount/add-product-entries

Headers

Authorization       required  

Example: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}

Content-Type       required  

Example: application/json

Accept       required  

Example: application/json

Body Parameters

data   object    required  
id   integer    required  

Example: 1

productEntries   integer[]    required  
rules   object  optional    
all   boolean  optional    

optional Example: false

FAQ

Get all FAQ items

requires authentication

Example request:
curl --request POST \
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/faq/get-list" \
    --header "Authorization: Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}" \
    --header "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --header "Accept: application/json"
const url = new URL(
    "http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/faq/get-list"
);

const headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Accept": "application/json",
};

fetch(url, {
    method: "POST",
    headers,
}).then(response => response.json());
$client = new \GuzzleHttp\Client();
$url = 'http://store-api.express.test/api/v3/faq/get-list';
$response = $client->post(
    $url,
    [
        'headers' => [
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer {YOUR_AUTH_KEY}',
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Accept' => 'application/json',
        ],
    ]
);
$body = $response->getBody();
print_r(json_decode((string) $body));
